36namespace ZXing {
37namespace QRCode {
38
39/**
40* <p>This method traces a line from a point in the image, in the direction towards another point.
41* It begins in a black region, and keeps going until it finds white, then black, then white again.
42* It reports the distance from the start to this point.</p>
43*
44* <p>This is used when figuring out how wide a finder pattern is, when the finder pattern
45* may be skewed or rotated.</p>
46*/
47static float SizeOfBlackWhiteBlackRun(const BitMatrix& image, int fromX, int fromY, int toX, int toY) {
48 // Mild variant of Bresenham's algorithm;
49 // see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bresenham's_line_algorithm
50 bool steep = std::abs(toY - fromY) > std::abs(toX - fromX);
51 if (steep) {
52 std::swap(fromX, fromY);
53 std::swap(toX, toY);
54 }
55
56 int dx = std::abs(toX - fromX);
57 int dy = std::abs(toY - fromY);
58 int error = -dx / 2;
59 int xstep = fromX < toX ? 1 : -1;
60 int ystep = fromY < toY ? 1 : -1;
61
62 // In black pixels, looking for white, first or second time.
63 int state = 0;
64 // Loop up until x == toX, but not beyond
65 int xLimit = toX + xstep;
66 for (int x = fromX, y = fromY; x != xLimit; x += xstep) {
67 int realX = steep ? y : x;
68 int realY = steep ? x : y;
69
70 // Does current pixel mean we have moved white to black or vice versa?
71 // Scanning black in state 0,2 and white in state 1, so if we find the wrong
72 // color, advance to next state or end if we are in state 2 already
73 if ((state == 1) == image.get(realX, realY)) {
74 if (state == 2) {
75 return ResultPoint::Distance(x, y, fromX, fromY);
76 }
77 state++;
78 }
79
80 error += dy;
81 if (error > 0) {
82 if (y == toY) {
83 break;
84 }
85 y += ystep;
86 error -= dx;
87 }
88 }
89 // Found black-white-black; give the benefit of the doubt that the next pixel outside the image
90 // is "white" so this last point at (toX+xStep,toY) is the right ending. This is really a
91 // small approximation; (toX+xStep,toY+yStep) might be really correct. Ignore this.
92 if (state == 2) {
93 return ResultPoint::Distance(toX + xstep, toY, fromX, fromY);
94 }
95 // else we didn't find even black-white-black; no estimate is really possible
96 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
97}
98
99/**
100* See {@link #sizeOfBlackWhiteBlackRun(int, int, int, int)}; computes the total width of
101* a finder pattern by looking for a black-white-black run from the center in the direction
102* of another point (another finder pattern center), and in the opposite direction too.
103*/
104static float SizeOfBlackWhiteBlackRunBothWays(const BitMatrix& image, int fromX, int fromY, int toX, int toY) {
105
106 float result = SizeOfBlackWhiteBlackRun(image, fromX, fromY, toX, toY);
107
108 // Now count other way -- don't run off image though of course
109 float scale = 1.0f;
110 int otherToX = fromX - (toX - fromX);
111 if (otherToX < 0) {
112 scale = (float)fromX / (float)(fromX - otherToX);
113 otherToX = 0;
114 }
115 else if (otherToX >= image.width()) {
116 scale = (float)(image.width() - 1 - fromX) / (float)(otherToX - fromX);
117 otherToX = image.width() - 1;
118 }
119 int otherToY = (int)(fromY - (toY - fromY) * scale);
120
121 scale = 1.0f;
122 if (otherToY < 0) {
123 scale = (float)fromY / (float)(fromY - otherToY);
124 otherToY = 0;
125 }
126 else if (otherToY >= image.height()) {
127 scale = (float)(image.height() - 1 - fromY) / (float)(otherToY - fromY);
128 otherToY = image.height() - 1;
129 }
130 otherToX = (int)(fromX + (otherToX - fromX) * scale);
131
132 result += SizeOfBlackWhiteBlackRun(image, fromX, fromY, otherToX, otherToY);
133
134 // Middle pixel is double-counted this way; subtract 1
135 return result - 1.0f;
136}
137
138/**
139* <p>Estimates module size based on two finder patterns -- it uses
140* {@link #sizeOfBlackWhiteBlackRunBothWays(int, int, int, int)} to figure the
141* width of each, measuring along the axis between their centers.</p>
142*/
143static float CalculateModuleSizeOneWay(const BitMatrix& image, const ResultPoint& pattern, const ResultPoint& otherPattern)
144{
145 float moduleSizeEst1 = SizeOfBlackWhiteBlackRunBothWays(image,
146 static_cast<int>(pattern.x()),
147 static_cast<int>(pattern.y()),
148 static_cast<int>(otherPattern.x()),
149 static_cast<int>(otherPattern.y()));
150
151 float moduleSizeEst2 = SizeOfBlackWhiteBlackRunBothWays(image,
152 static_cast<int>(otherPattern.x()),
153 static_cast<int>(otherPattern.y()),
154 static_cast<int>(pattern.x()),
155 static_cast<int>(pattern.y()));
156
157 if (std::isnan(moduleSizeEst1)) {
158 return moduleSizeEst2 / 7.0f;
159 }
160 if (std::isnan(moduleSizeEst2)) {
161 return moduleSizeEst1 / 7.0f;
162 }
163 // Average them, and divide by 7 since we've counted the width of 3 black modules,
164 // and 1 white and 1 black module on either side. Ergo, divide sum by 14.
165 return (moduleSizeEst1 + moduleSizeEst2) / 14.0f;
166}
167
168/**
169* <p>Computes an average estimated module size based on estimated derived from the positions
170* of the three finder patterns.</p>
171*
172* @param topLeft detected top-left finder pattern center
173* @param topRight detected top-right finder pattern center
174* @param bottomLeft detected bottom-left finder pattern center
175* @return estimated module size
176*/
177static float CalculateModuleSize(const BitMatrix& image, const ResultPoint& topLeft, const ResultPoint& topRight, const ResultPoint& bottomLeft)
178{
179 // Take the average
180 return (CalculateModuleSizeOneWay(image, topLeft, topRight) + CalculateModuleSizeOneWay(image, topLeft, bottomLeft)) / 2.0f;
181}
182
183
184/**
185* <p>Attempts to locate an alignment pattern in a limited region of the image, which is
186* guessed to contain it. This method uses {@link AlignmentPattern}.</p>
187*
188* @param overallEstModuleSize estimated module size so far
189* @param estAlignmentX x coordinate of center of area probably containing alignment pattern
190* @param estAlignmentY y coordinate of above
191* @param allowanceFactor number of pixels in all directions to search from the center
192* @return {@link AlignmentPattern} if found, or null otherwise
193* @throws NotFoundException if an unexpected error occurs during detection
194*/
195AlignmentPattern FindAlignmentInRegion(const BitMatrix& image, float overallEstModuleSize, int estAlignmentX, int estAlignmentY, float allowanceFactor)
196{
197 // Look for an alignment pattern (3 modules in size) around where it
198 // should be
199 int allowance = (int)(allowanceFactor * overallEstModuleSize);
200 int alignmentAreaLeftX = std::max(0, estAlignmentX - allowance);
201 int alignmentAreaRightX = std::min(image.width() - 1, estAlignmentX + allowance);
202 if (alignmentAreaRightX - alignmentAreaLeftX < overallEstModuleSize * 3) {
203 return {};
204 }
205
206 int alignmentAreaTopY = std::max(0, estAlignmentY - allowance);
207 int alignmentAreaBottomY = std::min(image.height() - 1, estAlignmentY + allowance);
208 if (alignmentAreaBottomY - alignmentAreaTopY < overallEstModuleSize * 3) {
209 return {};
210 }
211
212 return AlignmentPatternFinder::Find(image, alignmentAreaLeftX, alignmentAreaTopY, alignmentAreaRightX - alignmentAreaLeftX, alignmentAreaBottomY - alignmentAreaTopY, overallEstModuleSize);
213}
214
215static PerspectiveTransform CreateTransform(const ResultPoint& topLeft, const ResultPoint& topRight, const ResultPoint& bottomLeft, const AlignmentPattern& alignmentPattern, int dimension)
216{
217 auto quad = Rectangle(dimension, dimension, 3.5);
218 PointF bottomRight;
219 if (alignmentPattern.isValid()) {
220 bottomRight = alignmentPattern;
221 quad[2] = quad[2] + PointF(-3, -3);
222 } else {
223 // Don't have an alignment pattern, just make up the bottom-right point
224 bottomRight = topRight - topLeft + bottomLeft;
225 }
226
227 return {quad, {topLeft, topRight, bottomRight, bottomLeft}};
228}
229
230/**
231* <p>Computes the dimension (number of modules on a size) of the QR Code based on the position
232* of the finder patterns and estimated module size.</p>
233* Return -1 in case of error.
234*/
235static int ComputeDimension(const ResultPoint& topLeft, const ResultPoint& topRight, const ResultPoint& bottomLeft, float moduleSize)
236{
237 int tltrCentersDimension = RoundToNearest(distance(topLeft, topRight) / moduleSize);
238 int tlblCentersDimension = RoundToNearest(distance(topLeft, bottomLeft) / moduleSize);
239 int dimension = ((tltrCentersDimension + tlblCentersDimension) / 2) + 7;
240 switch (dimension & 0x03) { // mod 4
241 case 0:
242 return ++dimension;
243 case 1:
244 return dimension;
245 case 2:
246 return --dimension;
247 }
248 return -1; // to signal error;
249}
250
251static DetectorResult
252ProcessFinderPatternInfo(const BitMatrix& image, const FinderPatternInfo& info)
253{
254 float moduleSize = CalculateModuleSize(image, info.topLeft, info.topRight, info.bottomLeft);
255 if (moduleSize < 1.0f) {
256 return {};
257 }
258 int dimension = ComputeDimension(info.topLeft, info.topRight, info.bottomLeft, moduleSize);
259 if (dimension < 0)
260 return {};
261
262 const Version* provisionalVersion = Version::ProvisionalVersionForDimension(dimension);
263 if (provisionalVersion == nullptr)
264 return {};
265
266 int modulesBetweenFPCenters = provisionalVersion->dimensionForVersion() - 7;
267
268 AlignmentPattern alignmentPattern;
269
270 // Anything above version 1 has an alignment pattern
271 if (!provisionalVersion->alignmentPatternCenters().empty()) {
272
273 // Guess where a "bottom right" finder pattern would have been
274 float bottomRightX = info.topRight.x() - info.topLeft.x() + info.bottomLeft.x();
275 float bottomRightY = info.topRight.y() - info.topLeft.y() + info.bottomLeft.y();
276
277 // Estimate that alignment pattern is closer by 3 modules
278 // from "bottom right" to known top left location
279 float correctionToTopLeft = 1.0f - 3.0f / (float)modulesBetweenFPCenters;
280 int estAlignmentX = static_cast<int>(info.topLeft.x() + correctionToTopLeft * (bottomRightX - info.topLeft.x()));
281 int estAlignmentY = static_cast<int>(info.topLeft.y() + correctionToTopLeft * (bottomRightY - info.topLeft.y()));
282
283 // Kind of arbitrary -- expand search radius before giving up
284 for (int i = 4; i <= 16; i <<= 1) {
285 alignmentPattern = FindAlignmentInRegion(image, moduleSize, estAlignmentX, estAlignmentY, static_cast<float>(i));
286 if (alignmentPattern.isValid())
287 break;
288 }
289 // If we didn't find alignment pattern... well try anyway without it
290 }
291
292 PerspectiveTransform transform = CreateTransform(info.topLeft, info.topRight, info.bottomLeft, alignmentPattern, dimension);
293
294 return SampleGrid(image, dimension, dimension, transform);
295}
296
297/**
298* This method detects a code in a "pure" image -- that is, pure monochrome image
299* which contains only an unrotated, unskewed, image of a code, with some white border
300* around it. This is a specialized method that works exceptionally fast in this special
301* case.
302*/
303static DetectorResult DetectPure(const BitMatrix& image)
304{
305 const int minSize = 21; // Number of modules in the smallest QRCode (Version 1)
306 int left, top, width, height;
307 if (!image.findBoundingBox(left, top, width, height, minSize) || width != height) {
308 return {};
309 }
310
311 // find the first white pixel on the diagonal
312 int moduleSize = 1;
313 while (moduleSize < width / minSize && image.get(left + moduleSize, top + moduleSize))
314 ++moduleSize;
315
316 int matrixWidth = width / moduleSize;
317 int matrixHeight = height / moduleSize;
318 if (matrixWidth < minSize || matrixHeight < minSize) {
319 return {};
320 }
321
322 // Push in the "border" by half the module width so that we start
323 // sampling in the middle of the module. Just in case the image is a
324 // little off, this will help recover.
325 int msh = moduleSize / 2;
326 int right = left + width - 1;
327 int bottom = top + height - 1;
328
329 // Now just read off the bits (this is a crop + subsample)
330 return {Deflate(image, matrixWidth, matrixHeight, top + msh, left + msh, moduleSize),
331 {{left, top}, {right, top}, {right, bottom}, {left, bottom}}};
332}
333
334DetectorResult Detector::Detect(const BitMatrix& image, bool tryHarder, bool isPure)
335{
336 if (isPure)
337 return DetectPure(image);
338
339 FinderPatternInfo info = FinderPatternFinder::Find(image, tryHarder);
340
341 if (!info.isValid())
342 return {};
343
344 return ProcessFinderPatternInfo(image, info);
345}
346
